newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-BAYERN STRIP MATTHAEUS OF CAPTAINCY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BAYERN STRIP MATTHAEUS OF CAPTAINCY.

text.p: Lothar Matthaeus was dropped as captain of German champions Bayern Munich on Saturday following the newspaper publication of his "Secret Diaries", an insight into the club's season.
Bayern chairman Franz Beckenbauer said defender Thomas Helmer would take over as skipper.
"There are serious problems for Lothar. The diary was taken very badly by the board," said Bayern business manager Uli Hoeness.
The diary appeared on Friday and included details of a 10,000 marks ($5,800) bet Matthaeus made against former Bayern striker Juergen Klinsmann scoring 15 goals in the season.
Matthaeus lost the wager, made with Hoeness last winter, as Klinsmann scored precisely 15 goals helping Bayern win a record 14th title.
Sampdoria-bound Klinsmann was shocked by the bet and said he could no longer take his former team mate seriously.
